thread.title: Southwest's tragic engine failure shows need for 'deeper' look at entire oversight: Ex-NTSB chair

author: Berkeley Lovelace Jr.
title: Southwest's tragic engine failure shows need for 'deeper' look at entire oversight: Ex-NTSB chair
text: Southwest's tragic engine failure shows need for 'deeper' look at entire oversight: Ex-NTSB chair Berkeley Lovelace Jr. â€¢ April 18, 2018 The Southwest Airlines engine failure that resulted in a passenger's death shows the need for an extensive review, former NTSB Chairman Jim Hall says. Hall also says it's probably too early to tell whether something like metal fatigue would appear in a routine inspection. The Southwest Airlines LUV engine failure that resulted in a passenger's death shows the need for an extensive review, but the sky remains "very safe," former National Transportation Safety Board Chairman Jim Hall said Wednesday.
